processors.name: Cat HTML file to run client page

labels.label:
Enabling Controller Services 1. Right-click the process group 2. Select Configure 3. Find the lightning-bolt icon - you may have to click the arrow on the right side to show the action icons 4. Click the lightning-bolt icon and select Enable from the pop-up window
5. Once the controller services have been enabled, you can start the process group

Enabling Controller Services 1. Right-click the process group 2. Select Configure 3. Find the lightning-bolt icon - you may have to click the arrow on the right side to show the action icons 4. Click the lightning-bolt icon and select Enable from the pop-up window
5. Once the controller services have been enabled, you can start the process group

processGroups.name: Stream to and from Kafka Grp

labels.label:
Read data from cloudair us_customers table and write the data to HDFS directory /tmp/us_customers
1. Use Ranger to grant read permission to NiFi on Hive warehouse cloudair database and tables.
2. Configure the Hive connector for SelectHiveQL. Move the hdfs-site.xml and core-site.xml into /etc/nifi/conf on every node in the cluster. Configure the connector to use the the three master nodes for zookeeper port 2181. Set this for the Primary node.
3. Configure a file name change to a single file name, this will then allow the follow on data to append to the file.
4. Configure the PutHDFS. This requires a principal of nifi@CLOUDAIR.LAN and a keytab of nifi.headless.keytab. This keytab must be in /etc/security/keytabs on every NiFi node. Ensure the conflict resolution is append.

processGroups.name: Export from Hive to HDFS Grp

labels.label:
Read data from PostgreSQL cloudair table and write the data to HDFS directory /data/cloudair/table. NiFi will create an Avro file format for the data.
1. Configure the db connector. Set the jdbc connect string, the jdbc driver and the jdbc jar file location. Set the db user and password. Set this for the Primary node. 2. QueryDatabaseTable query table 3. SplitAvro reduces the Avro files to a single record each, if they are not already. 4. ConvertAvroToJSON converts Avro records to individual JSON objects, not in arrays. Set JSON container options to None 5. MergeContent to group the JSON lines back into files. This is grouping grouping them into 100 files. Set strategy to Text and add a line return to Delimiter (Shift-Return) 6. UpdateAttribute. Configure a file name change to a single file name, this will then allow the follow on data to append to the file. 7. PutHDFS. This requires a principal of nifi@CLOUDAIR.LAN and a keytab of nifi.headless.keytab. This keytab must be in /etc/security/keytabs on every NiFi node. Ensure the conflict resolution is append.
